question_sentence: How many doses of the Novavax coronavirus vaccine has the UK ordered?
A royal documentary banned by the Queen that was leaked on YouTube this week before being hastily removed was originally broadcast by the BBC when?
What is the name of the AstraZeneca boss who has described the EU as ‘emotional’ and ‘aggravated’ during a row over delayed vaccine deliveries?
When are UK pubs scheduled to reopen under a three-step lockdown easing plan reportedly being drawn up by government officials?
A crochet doll of Bernie Sanders based on a photo of the US senator that was taken at Joe Biden’s inauguration has sold for how much?
Who is replacing Frank Lampard as manager of Chelsea Football Club after the former England star was sacked this week?
Which country has put a two-week ban on privately educated pupils being taught remotely in order to level the playing field while state schools are closed during lockdown?
The world’s largest vaccine manufacturer, the Serum Institute of India, is aiming to produce how many doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca coronavirus jab per month?
The departing governor of which British overseas territory has made headlines by accusing the local government of overseeing a ‘plague’ of corruption?
Fashion brand Boohoo is in talks to buy the ‘online business’ and ‘associated intellectual property’ of which collapsed retail chain?
The single article of impeachment against former President Trump was delivered to the Senate this week. Of the 50-person Republican caucus, how many agreed that the trial should proceed?
evidence: Only five Republican senators joined their Democratic colleagues in supporting the trial. In order to convict, at least 17 Republicans would need to be on board – Sen. Rand Paul called the impeachment article “dead on arrival.”

question_sentence: Former White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders announced that she’ll be running for governor of which US state?
evidence: Sanders announced her candidacy for governor of the state of Arkansas, following in her father Mike Huckabee’s footsteps who led the state from 1996 to 2007.

question_sentence: Which major pharmaceutical company announced that they’re stopping development of two of their vaccine candidates and pivoting to Covid-19 treatment instead?
evidence: Merck made the decision to drop its V590 and V591 vaccine candidates after initial results showed little efficacy in preventing Covid-19 compared to natural infection and other vaccines.

question_sentence: Several variants of the coronavirus are popping up in the US. This week, South Carolina reported the first cases of a variant originally found in which country?
evidence: The South African variant was detected in South Carolina, the first case of its kind seen in the United States. Though possibly more infectious, authorities don’t believe it causes more serious disease.

question_sentence: What is the name of the online Reddit community that’s credited with influencing what many coin the now global ‘GameStop mania’ phenomenon?
evidence: Followers of the WallStreetBets subreddit galvanized millions of its fellow users to buy and wildly drive up the price of shares of video game retailer GameStop and other companies such as AMC – all of it an attempt to thwart Wall Street short-sellers and large hedge funds betting against the companies, an unprecedented move driven entirely by ordinary retail investors using free brokerage apps and mobilizing online around the world.

question_sentence: Janet Yellen was confirmed this week, becoming the first woman in American history to take up what presidential cabinet position?
evidence: Yellen was confirmed as the Secretary of the Treasury. No stranger to top economic positions, Yellen was also the first female to chair the Federal Reserve while serving under President Obama.

question_sentence: It was ruled that the four men convicted of the 2002 kidnapping and murder of American journalist Daniel Pearl were allowed to go free. Where did this crime happen?
evidence: Pakistan’s Supreme Court made the ruling, which has since drawn international condemnation with the White House saying it’s an “affront to terrorism victims everywhere.”

question_sentence: Hundreds of thousands of protesters took to the streets of New Delhi to challenge newly implement agricultural reforms. What were many of the protester’s riding?
evidence: Protesters, the majority farmers, arrived on tractors in a display of defiance against the laws that they say put their livelihoods at risk and benefit large corporations.

question_sentence: Which classic boxed cereal brand is struggling from a product shortage, though its brand manager promised to be ‘fully back’ back on shelves in the spring?
evidence: According to brand manager Kirstin DeRock, Grape-Nuts is struggling from a product shortage due to supply chain constraints and higher demand for cereal. The iconic cereal came about in 1897, developed by C.W. Post himself.

question_sentence: A new study published in the journal General Psychiatry found which activity led to signs of better mental agility in adults over 60?
evidence: The study found that afternoon nappers saw the increase in mental agility. The study itself analyzed napping habits in over 2,000 participants in China, measuring their memory, language and other cognitive abilities.
